main event: On May 30, 1949, in El Paso, Texas, a highly reflective, oblong, and shiny object caught the attention of observers while they were watching a fighter plane in the air. The object was in sight for 3 minutes, reached an altitude of about 75Â°, and traveled from overhead to east by north east before disappearing into the clouds.
interesting points: The object was about one inch long, looked glassy or shiny, and had no sound or odor associated with it.
It turned slowly on its longitudinal axis and disappeared into the clouds without leaving a trail.
Witnesses included military personnel who were reasonably intelligent and reliable, according to the comments of the interrogator.
Weather conditions at the time of the sighting included clear, bright light, a wind speed of 10 MPH, and scattered clouds with no reported effect on the sighting.
No photographs or sketches of the object were obtained, and there were no signed statements or physical evidence collected.
sighted object: one highly reflective, oblong, and shiny object
